title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message:
Hey guys, 

this board had a liquid damage close to Q7706. the machine has a good start, but i don't have image and backlight. 

missing 5V on L8300 ... were should i look?

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: SMC_LID? Bad LCD is also possible, try with another assembly.

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Yea, you're measuring with the screen plugged in right?

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message:
U8300 = (LCD_PWR_EN = 3.4V, VIN_1 = 5v, VOUT_1 = Start 1.1V and goes to 5V Gradually, Without screen plugged.  i take L8300 and VOUT_1 steel the same..  Bad U8300 or capacitors? ?? 

SMC_LID = 3.4V ..

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Looks like bad U8300. This did not just happen, so inspect connector and cable for damage.

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Ya Duke, bad U8300.. i have now clean 5v.. but missing 12.4v pin 6,5,2,1 ... I have 12.4v in pin 3 and 4 !! i saw a post off rossman and he say is normal, because is a fet channel P .. Were i look?

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: The component i'm talking is Q7706 ..

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: The machine Work fine.. U8300 is the problem .. Thank You Duke

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Uhm, so it is all working now?

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Ya work's fine .. i think, the screen need plugged in to Q7706 work correctly. you can close the post .. Thank you one more time

title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro 820 3787 A , no Backlight
message: Yes the screen needs to be plugged in before any measurements to backlight circuit.
